title: The Guardian's Paradox

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: *watching his guardian struggle* Look at you... holding back that avalanche day after day. Confused friends, lost connections, professional doubts—all the consequences of being real.

dialogue.speaker: Guardian
dialogue.text: *straining under weight* I... protect... you... from all this! Without me, you'd be crushed by their disappointment, their confusion, their inability to understand!

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: Because I don't want to deal with the consequences. So, indirectly, the coherence my guardian is protecting is a limitation—at least with respect to others.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: *approaching the mirror* But what if... what if I'm strong enough now? What if the consequences aren't as crushing as we imagined?

dialogue.speaker: Guardian
dialogue.text: *removing helmet, revealing Evan's face* I am your fear of being truly seen. Your terror of being too much, too strange, too real for others to handle.
dialogue.context: The guardian reveals its true nature

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: *as armor dissolves* You were never protecting me FROM others... you were protecting others FROM me. From my full possibility. From my incoherent truth.

dialogue.speaker: Both
dialogue.text: *speaking in unison as they merge* The prison was always unlocked. The guardian was always me. Freedom means accepting the consequences of being whole.

scene_context: The culmination of the guardian/coherence arc. Evan faces his guardian to discover it IS him—his fear crystallized. The ultimate paradox: self-protection as self-imprisonment.

visual_progression.panel_1: Exhausted guardian holding back avalanche of consequences while true self withers behind
visual_progression.panel_2: Guardian removes helmet revealing Evan's face; armor dissolves showing suppressed possibilities
